payload.content: Most people use OpenClaw like a chat toy, asking questions and generating code, while those gaining significant leverage use it to hand off entire workflows.

name: Most people use OpenClaw like a chat toy, asking questions and generating code,
content: Most people use OpenClaw like a chat toy, asking questions and generating code, while those gaining significant leverage use it to hand off entire workflows.

payload.content: The difference in leveraging AI agents for workflows versus simple queries is not the underlying model, but the specific skills installed.

name: The difference in leveraging AI agents for workflows versus simple queries is no
content: The difference in leveraging AI agents for workflows versus simple queries is not the underlying model, but the specific skills installed.

payload.content: Five OpenClaw skills by Peter Steinberger (@steipete) are identified as transformative for agent capabilities: Gog (Google Workspace), Summarize (web pages, PDFs, YouTube), Github (issues, PRs, CI), Nano Banana Pro (image generation via Gemini 3 Pro), and Nano Pdf (PDF editing).

name: Five OpenClaw skills by Peter Steinberger (@steipete) are identified as transfor
content: Five OpenClaw skills by Peter Steinberger (@steipete) are identified as transformative for agent capabilities: Gog (Google Workspace), Summarize (web pages, PDFs, YouTube), Github (issues, PRs, CI), Nano Banana Pro (image generation via Gemini 3 Pro), and Nano Pdf (PDF editing).

payload.content: Gog is a Google Workspace CLI that allows an AI agent to interact with Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Contacts, Sheets, and Docs, enabling the agent to perform tasks directly within these applications after OAuth setup.

name: Gog is a Google Workspace CLI that allows an AI agent to interact with Gmail, Ca
content: Gog is a Google Workspace CLI that allows an AI agent to interact with Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Contacts, Sheets, and Docs, enabling the agent to perform tasks directly within these applications after OAuth setup.

payload.content: To enable an AI agent to manage Google Workspace tasks, install Gog (e.g., `brew install steipete/tap/gogcli`) and configure OAuth, allowing the agent to access and manipulate data in Gmail, Calendar, Sheets, and Docs.

name: To enable an AI agent to manage Google Workspace tasks, install Gog (e.g., `brew
content: To enable an AI agent to manage Google Workspace tasks, install Gog (e.g., `brew install steipete/tap/gogcli`) and configure OAuth, allowing the agent to access and manipulate data in Gmail, Calendar, Sheets, and Docs.

payload.content: Use Gog commands like `gog gmail search`, `gog calendar events`, `gog sheets get`, and `gog docs cat` to allow an AI agent to scan emails, pull schedules, read spreadsheets, and access Google Docs content.

name: Use Gog commands like `gog gmail search`, `gog calendar events`, `gog sheets get
content: Use Gog commands like `gog gmail search`, `gog calendar events`, `gog sheets get`, and `gog docs cat` to allow an AI agent to scan emails, pull schedules, read spreadsheets, and access Google Docs content.

payload.content: When using an AI agent with Gog to send emails, implement a guardrail where the agent always asks for approval before sending, preventing unauthorized communications.

name: When using an AI agent with Gog to send emails, implement a guardrail where the
content: When using an AI agent with Gog to send emails, implement a guardrail where the agent always asks for approval before sending, preventing unauthorized communications.

payload.content: Summarize is an OpenClaw skill that provides concise summaries of web pages, PDFs, and YouTube videos using Gemini, and its power is amplified when an AI agent chains multiple summaries for comprehensive briefings.

name: Summarize is an OpenClaw skill that provides concise summaries of web pages, PDF
content: Summarize is an OpenClaw skill that provides concise summaries of web pages, PDFs, and YouTube videos using Gemini, and its power is amplified when an AI agent chains multiple summaries for comprehensive briefings.

payload.content: To install Nano Banana Pro, ensure `gh` is installed and authenticated by running `gh auth login`.

name: To install Nano Banana Pro, ensure `gh` is installed and authenticated by runnin
content: To install Nano Banana Pro, ensure `gh` is installed and authenticated by running `gh auth login`.

payload.content: To summarize content, use the `summarize` command with a URL, file path, or YouTube link, optionally specifying `--length short` for key points, `--json` for programmatic output, or `FIRECRAWL_API_KEY` for paywalled sites.

name: To summarize content, use the `summarize` command with a URL, file path, or YouT
content: To summarize content, use the `summarize` command with a URL, file path, or YouTube link, optionally specifying `--length short` for key points, `--json` for programmatic output, or `FIRECRAWL_API_KEY` for paywalled sites.

payload.content: Nano Banana Pro is a tool that integrates Google's Gemini 3 Pro Image model for text-to-image and image-to-image editing, supporting 1K, 2K, and 4K resolutions.

name: Nano Banana Pro is a tool that integrates Google's Gemini 3 Pro Image model for
content: Nano Banana Pro is a tool that integrates Google's Gemini 3 Pro Image model for text-to-image and image-to-image editing, supporting 1K, 2K, and 4K resolutions.

payload.content: Integrating image generation directly into an agent's workflow, rather than using separate tools like Midjourney, significantly streamlines the creative process.

name: Integrating image generation directly into an agent's workflow, rather than usin
content: Integrating image generation directly into an agent's workflow, rather than using separate tools like Midjourney, significantly streamlines the creative process.

payload.content: Nano Banana Pro can be used for generating blog post hero images (drafting in 1K, finalizing in 4K), quick product mockups, social media images matching specific aesthetics, and editing existing images (e.g., 'make the background darker and add more contrast').

name: Nano Banana Pro can be used for generating blog post hero images (drafting in 1K
content: Nano Banana Pro can be used for generating blog post hero images (drafting in 1K, finalizing in 4K), quick product mockups, social media images matching specific aesthetics, and editing existing images (e.g., 'make the background darker and add more contrast').

payload.content: To generate an image using Nano Banana Pro, run `uv run ~/.openclaw/skills/nano-banana-pro/scripts/generate_image.py --prompt "..." --filename "output.png" --resolution 1K`.

name: To generate an image using Nano Banana Pro, run `uv run ~/.openclaw/skills/nano-
content: To generate an image using Nano Banana Pro, run `uv run ~/.openclaw/skills/nano-banana-pro/scripts/generate_image.py --prompt "..." --filename "output.png" --resolution 1K`.

payload.content: To edit an existing image with Nano Banana Pro, use `uv run ~/.openclaw/skills/nano-banana-pro/scripts/generate_image.py --prompt "make the sky more dramatic" --filename "output.png" --input-image "path/to/input.png"`.

name: To edit an existing image with Nano Banana Pro, use `uv run ~/.openclaw/skills/n
content: To edit an existing image with Nano Banana Pro, use `uv run ~/.openclaw/skills/nano-banana-pro/scripts/generate_image.py --prompt "make the sky more dramatic" --filename "output.png" --input-image "path/to/input.png"`.

payload.content: To save costs when using Nano Banana Pro, draft images at 1K resolution and iterate on the prompt until satisfied before generating the final 4K version, as 4K generations are more expensive.

name: To save costs when using Nano Banana Pro, draft images at 1K resolution and iter
content: To save costs when using Nano Banana Pro, draft images at 1K resolution and iterate on the prompt until satisfied before generating the final 4K version, as 4K generations are more expensive.

payload.content: Nano Banana Pro requires a Gemini API key, which can be set as an environment variable `GEMINI_API_KEY` or passed via the `--api-key` argument.

name: Nano Banana Pro requires a Gemini API key, which can be set as an environment va
content: Nano Banana Pro requires a Gemini API key, which can be set as an environment variable `GEMINI_API_KEY` or passed via the `--api-key` argument.

payload.content: Integrating visual creation into the workflow prevents procrastination on visual tasks.

name: Integrating visual creation into the workflow prevents procrastination on visual
content: Integrating visual creation into the workflow prevents procrastination on visual tasks.

payload.content: Nano Pdf is a tool that enables agents to edit PDFs using natural-language instructions, page by page.

name: Nano Pdf is a tool that enables agents to edit PDFs using natural-language instr
content: Nano Pdf is a tool that enables agents to edit PDFs using natural-language instructions, page by page.

payload.content: To edit a PDF with Nano Pdf, use a command like `nano-pdf edit deck.pdf 1 "Change the title to 'Q3 Results' and fix the typo in the subtitle"`.

name: To edit a PDF with Nano Pdf, use a command like `nano-pdf edit deck.pdf 1 "Chang
content: To edit a PDF with Nano Pdf, use a command like `nano-pdf edit deck.pdf 1 "Change the title to 'Q3 Results' and fix the typo in the subtitle"`.

payload.content: When using Nano Pdf, always sanity-check page numbering (0-based or 1-based) and review the output before sharing.

name: When using Nano Pdf, always sanity-check page numbering (0-based or 1-based) and
content: When using Nano Pdf, always sanity-check page numbering (0-based or 1-based) and review the output before sharing.

payload.content: Using Nano Pdf eliminates the time-consuming process of manually editing PDFs with traditional software like Adobe.

name: Using Nano Pdf eliminates the time-consuming process of manually editing PDFs wi
content: Using Nano Pdf eliminates the time-consuming process of manually editing PDFs with traditional software like Adobe.

payload.content: To install Nano Pdf, use the command `uv tool install nano-pdf`.

name: To install Nano Pdf, use the command `uv tool install nano-pdf`.
content: To install Nano Pdf, use the command `uv tool install nano-pdf`.

payload.content: To set up OpenClaw skills, first install the underlying CLI tools: `gogcli` via `brew install steipete/tap/gogcli`, `summarize` via `brew install steipete/tap/summarize`, `gh` (authenticated), `nano-pdf` via `uv tool install nano-pdf`, and ensure `uv` and a `GEMINI_API_KEY` are available for Nano Banana Pro.

name: To set up OpenClaw skills, first install the underlying CLI tools: `gogcli` via
content: To set up OpenClaw skills, first install the underlying CLI tools: `gogcli` via `brew install steipete/tap/gogcli`, `summarize` via `brew install steipete/tap/summarize`, `gh` (authenticated), `nano-pdf` via `uv tool install nano-pdf`, and ensure `uv` and a `GEMINI_API_KEY` are available for Nano Banana Pro.

payload.content: After installing CLI tools, install the skills (`gog`, `summarize`, `github`, `nano-banana-pro`, `nano-pdf`) in OpenClaw and verify with `openclaw skills list` and `openclaw skills check`.

name: After installing CLI tools, install the skills (`gog`, `summarize`, `github`, `n
content: After installing CLI tools, install the skills (`gog`, `summarize`, `github`, `nano-banana-pro`, `nano-pdf`) in OpenClaw and verify with `openclaw skills list` and `openclaw skills check`.

payload.content: Test each OpenClaw skill after installation: `gog gmail search 'newer_than:1d' --max 5` for Gog, summarize a public URL for Summarize, `gh run list --repo <your-repo> --limit 5` for Github, generate a 1K test image for Nano Banana Pro, and edit a throwaway PDF for Nano Pdf.

name: Test each OpenClaw skill after installation: `gog gmail search 'newer_than:1d' -
content: Test each OpenClaw skill after installation: `gog gmail search 'newer_than:1d' --max 5` for Gog, summarize a public URL for Summarize, `gh run list --repo <your-repo> --limit 5` for Github, generate a 1K test image for Nano Banana Pro, and edit a throwaway PDF for Nano Pdf.

payload.content: If an OpenClaw skill breaks during testing, `openclaw skills check` can help identify missing components.

name: If an OpenClaw skill breaks during testing, `openclaw skills check` can help ide
content: If an OpenClaw skill breaks during testing, `openclaw skills check` can help identify missing components.

payload.content: An OpenClaw agent can automate the installation and validation of skills by providing it with a detailed prompt outlining steps, non-negotiables (e.g., 'Do NOT send emails without my explicit approval'), and specific test commands for each skill.

name: An OpenClaw agent can automate the installation and validation of skills by prov
content: An OpenClaw agent can automate the installation and validation of skills by providing it with a detailed prompt outlining steps, non-negotiables (e.g., 'Do NOT send emails without my explicit approval'), and specific test commands for each skill.

content: To install the @steipete summarize skill, install the CLI via: `brew install steipete/tap/summarize`.

content: Individually, skills like a Google CLI, summarizer, GitHub wrapper, image generator, or PDF editor are not complicated.

payload.content: Installing these skills together transforms an agent from a chatbot that writes code and answers questions into a coworker that operates within existing systems like inboxes, repositories, documents, and files.

name: Installing these skills together transforms an agent from a chatbot that writes
content: Installing these skills together transforms an agent from a chatbot that writes code and answers questions into a coworker that operates within existing systems like inboxes, repositories, documents, and files.

payload.content: Many people fail to integrate these tools, thinking they will set them up later, leading to continued manual copy-pasting between AI tools and their work.

name: Many people fail to integrate these tools, thinking they will set them up later,
content: Many people fail to integrate these tools, thinking they will set them up later, leading to continued manual copy-pasting between AI tools and their work.
